Dear Mr. Alward:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 05/25/2021. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
The violations that were found are:
R 400.10115 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
A facility shall document that each employee and each
volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or more hours
per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free from
communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 3-year period
before employment and shall be verified every 3 years after
the last verification.
One of fifteen employee files reviewed did not have documentation of the required
Tuberculosis testing being completed on the employee. This involved one of the nine
new (hire within the last year) employees.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

A tour of the facility occurred, and the facility was observed to be well maintained, clean
and organized. Meal menus were posted. During the tour residents were observed in
classrooms. Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by management. Staff
indicated there have been few physical managements performed throughout the year
and they report de-escalation first and physical management as a last resort. Residents
stated that they feel safe at the facility and well cared for. They also reported having
healthy support, activities, education, and services at the facility. Staff stated they feel
safe at the facility. A sample of restraint and seclusions documentation were reviewed
by this consultant. All incidences reviewed, staff responded appropriately and there
were no concerns noted.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
IF NECESSARY
A follow-up inspection may be made to verify compliance. Should the corrections not be
made in the specified time, it may be necessary to reevaluate the status of your certificate
of inspection.
The Department provides technical assistance to meet the licensing requirements and
consultation to improve services. Please contact me with any questions.
In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately,
please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
